data.name: Simple non-decreasing array
data.description:
In this Kata, you will be given an array of integers and you can either: 

* increase any one element by `1`, or 
* decrease any one element by `1`.

Your goal is to return the minimal number of steps that will make the array **non-decreasing**. A sequence is non-decreasing if `a1 ≤ a2 ≤ ... ≤ aN` holds, where `N` is the length of the sequence.

For example:
```Haskell
solve ([3,2,-1,2,8]) = 4

Steps are:
> change arr[0] => 3 -> 2. New arr is [2,2,-1,2,8]
> change arr[2] => -1 -> 0. New arr is [2,2,0,2,8]
> change arr[2] => 0 -> 1. New arr is [2,2,1,2,8]
> change arr[2] => 1 -> 2. New arr is [2,2,2,2,8]
These are 4 steps.
```

Input array length is: `0 < array length < 1000`

More examples in test cases. 
Good luck!
